description.p: A PALADIN OF THE OATH OF THE RAVEN dedicates their soul to the service of The Raven Queen. These knights embrace the beauty of life and the sanctity of death, and swear to destroy anything that disrupts the natural cycle. Known as Knight of The Raven, these warriors serve as The Raven Queen's emissaries in the mortal realm, clad in black armor adorned with raven wings and raven feather motifs.

The Oath of the Raven revolves around respecting the impartial nature of death and ensuring the cycle of life and death is unbroken. The first three tenets emphasize obedience to the natural order, while the fourth speaks to the merciless judgement of The Raven Queen upon those who defy it.
Accept Your Fate. Every soul must pass beyond at its appointed time, neither early nor late.
Guide the Passage. Ensure souls transition peacefully; allow no force to chain them to the mortal realm.
Shatter the Defiant. Oppose those who hinder the passage of souls; those who disrupt the cycle are beyond redemption.
Uphold the Judgement. Adhere to the laws of life and death; offer no mercy, only absolute and impartial justice.
You gain the following Oath Spells at the paladin levels listed. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

td.em: protection from evil and good, false life

description.p: You gain the following two Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

Chains of the Dark Feather. As an action, you can summon shadowy chains resembling raven feathers. Each enemy creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its movement speed reduced to 0, and if it is an undead or fiend it has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws while restrained. A restrained creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Rebuke the Damned. When a creature within 30 feet of you deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it takes necrotic damage equal to the damage it just dealt; on a success, it takes half as much.

description.p: Whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, that creature takes necrotic damage. The amount is 2d8 + your Charisma modifier, or 3d8 + your Charisma modifier if it is a fiend or an undead, provided you aren’t incapacitated.

description.p: For 1 hour, you assume a raven-like avatar, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: You sprout black raven wings and gain a flying speed of 60 feet.
Enemies entering or starting their turn in a 30-foot aura take 2d8 necrotic damage.

Enemies have disadvantage on attack rolls against you, and all allies within 30 feet gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier at the start of each of their turns. These temporary hit points cannot be stack.

description.p: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Assume a raven-like avatar for 1 hour, gaining flight, an aura of necrotic damage, and enemy-related protections.
